items.question: What is the Customer Due Diligence (CDD) process?
items.answer: Under Article 5-2 of the Act on Reporting and Using Specified Financial Transaction Information, the CDD process ensures that KODA's products and services are not used for money laundering or other illegal activities. This involves verifying the customer's identity (legal name, address, contact information), transaction purpose, source of funds, and beneficial ownership.

items.question: What happens if the CDD process is not completed?
items.answer: From the inspection date prior to CDD implementation (as separately announced), existing client login sessions will expire, and virtual asset withdrawals will be suspended. Once the CDD process is completed, clients may resume using withdrawal services for their custodied assets.

items.question: Do new clients need to complete the CDD process?
items.answer: Newly registered clients must complete the CDD process after its implementation to fully access custody services for virtual assets.

items.question: What is the CDD procedure for existing clients?
items.answer: Existing corporate clients are also required to complete the CDD process through in-person verification. The required documents and procedures will be provided separately.

items.question: When did KODA implement the CDD process?
items.answer: ㅇ CDD Implementation Date: December 17, 2021 (00:00 KST)

ethicalManagement.title: Ethical Management Policy
ethicalManagement.introduction: Korea Digital Asset Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as the "Company") emphasizes the importance of ethical management and has established this Code of Ethics to reflect the spirit of the Charter of Ethics. The Company pledges that all executives and employees shall adhere to proper ethical judgment standards and occupational ethics, and shall faithfully practice them.

article1.title: Article 1 (Purpose)
article1.content: The purpose of this Code of Ethics (hereinafter referred to as the "Code") is to provide employees of virtual asset service providers, as defined under Article 2(1) of the Act on Reporting and Using Specified Financial Transaction Information, with standards for practicing ethical management, making proper ethical decisions, and ensuring ethical judgment. By faithfully carrying out their responsibilities and duties as professionals in the virtual asset industry, employees shall contribute to the protection of customers, enhancement of corporate value, and ultimately to the development of society.

article2.title: Article 2 (Scope of Application)
article2.content1: This Code applies to all executives and employees of the Company, including contract and temporary staff.
article2.content2: Both the Company and its employees shall endeavor to comply with this Code, and detailed provisions necessary for compliance may be specified in internal regulations.

article1.title: Article 1 (Client First)
article1.content: The Company recognizes clients as the top priority in all actions, always thinking and acting from the client's perspective, and striving to provide better virtual asset services.

article2.title: Article 2 (Client Protection)
article2.content: The Company shall securely protect clients' assets and information and shall not engage in any immoral or unethical acts that infringe upon clients' rights and interests.

article3.title: Article 3 (Respect for Clients)
article3.content: All executives and employees shall always listen to clients' opinions and suggestions with humility, and promptly and fairly handle any client complaints.

chapter3.title: Chapter 3. Ethics Toward Shareholders and Investors

article1.title: Article 1 (Protection of Shareholders' and Investors' Rights and Interests)
article1.content1: The Company protects the rights of shareholders and investors and ensures the accuracy and reliability of accounting data by adhering to transparent and reasonable decision-making processes and procedures.
article1.content2: The Company respects the legitimate demands and proposals of shareholders and investors, providing necessary information accurately and in a timely manner in accordance with relevant laws and internal regulations to enable rational decision-making.
article1.content3: The Company treats all shareholders fairly and equally, making management decisions with consideration of the interests of all shareholders, ensuring that no shareholder's rights or interests are unjustly infringed.

chapter4.title: Chapter 4. Ethics Toward the Nation and Society

article1.title: Article 1 (Contribution to National Economy and Social Development)
article1.content1: As a member of the nation and local community, the Company strives to contribute to economic growth and job creation, and promotes various initiatives that add socio-economic value to communities and their members, thereby fulfilling its social responsibilities.
article1.content2: The Company and all employees shall enhance society by achieving technological innovation and business advancement, providing convenient and efficient services, and practicing reasonable and responsible management to improve the quality of life of customers.

article2.title: Article 2 (Disaster Prevention and Environmental Protection)
article2.content: The Company recognizes environmental issues as an important element of management, complies with domestic and international environmental laws and regulations, and adheres to all safety-related laws and standards to make every effort to prevent disasters and manage risks.

article3.title: Article 3 (Prohibition of Political Participation)
article3.content1: The Company shall not express opinions or take actions in support of specific political parties or candidates that may compromise political neutrality. Donations to political or charitable organizations shall be made in compliance with relevant laws.
article3.content2: All employees shall refrain from engaging in political activities during working hours and from using Company personnel or assets for political purposes.
article3.content3: The political rights and opinions of individual employees shall be respected, but they must ensure that their personal political activities are not misconstrued as representing the Company's position.

chapter5.title: Chapter 5. Ethics Toward Competitors and Business Partners

article1.title: Article 1 (Compliance with Domestic and International Laws)
article1.content: The Company complies with laws related to the prevention of corruption, bribery, and money laundering, both domestically and internationally, and respects international agreements, regulations, and local laws, cultures, and customs as a member of the global community.

article2.title: Article 2 (Fair Competition and Transactions)
article2.content1: The Company respects the principles of free competition and fair market order, competes fairly with peers based on mutual respect, and complies with relevant fair trade laws.
article2.content2: Through fair and transparent business practices, the Company builds trust and cooperation with business partners, pursues mutual growth, and refrains from making any unfair demands by exploiting a superior position. The Company enters into and complies with fair and clean contracts.

chapter6.title: Chapter 6. Ethics Toward Executives and Employees

article1.title: Article 1 (Respect and Fair Treatment)
article1.content: The Company respects the fundamental human rights and privacy of all employees, prohibits unfair discrimination on the basis of gender, education, region of origin, family background, alma mater, religion, age, disability, or marital status, and provides equal opportunities based on ability and aptitude, offering reasonable rewards based on fair performance evaluation.

article2.title: Article 2 (Talent Development and Support)
article2.content1: The Company respects employees' autonomy and creativity, provides fair job opportunities to enhance their capabilities, and supports employees' self-realization by fostering talent and increasing job satisfaction.
article2.content2: The Company supports employees in achieving their goals, actively provides necessary training opportunities, and strives to create a work environment and organizational culture that enables employees to maximize their abilities.

article3.title: Article 3 (Improvement of Quality of Life)
article3.content1: The Company regards all employees as its most valuable asset, establishes systems enabling them to perform duties fairly, and endeavors to create a pleasant working environment.
article3.content2: The Company respects employees' independence and fundamental rights, fostering a mature organizational culture where employees can freely make suggestions and proposals based on mutual trust.

chapter7.title: Chapter 7. Work Ethics of Executives and Employees

article1.title: Article 1 (Basic Ethics and Compliance with Laws)
article1.content1: All employees shall share the Company's management philosophy and vision, faithfully fulfill their duties to realize the Company's goals and values, and perform their assigned missions with integrity and sincerity.
article1.content2: Employees shall uphold honesty and trust as core values, faithfully performing duties in accordance with the principle of good faith.
article1.content3: Employees shall not engage in conduct that damages the Company's dignity or social credibility, and shall continually strive for self-innovation with creative thinking to adapt flexibly to changes in the management environment.
article1.content4: Employees shall comply with all relevant laws and regulations related to their duties, uphold social values and conscience, and faithfully perform their responsibilities.

article2.title: Article 2 (Prohibition of Conflicts of Interest)
article2.content1: Employees shall prioritize the Company's interests over personal or departmental interests when conflicts arise.
article2.content2: Any business opportunities discovered during employment must be reported to and belong primarily to the Company.
article2.content3: Employees must ensure that their personal interests do not conflict with those of the Company, shareholders, or customers, and must disclose in advance any potential conflicts of interest.

article3.title: Article 3 (Prohibition of Insider Trading and Unfair Transactions)
article3.content1: Employees shall not engage in unfair trading for personal gain, such as buying or selling securities or virtual assets, or manipulating prices using insider information obtained in the course of work.
article3.content2: Employees shall not disclose non-public material information that could affect stock or virtual asset prices to third parties without following lawful procedures.

article4.title: Article 4 (Protection of Company Assets)
article4.content1: Employees shall use all tangible and intangible assets of the Company solely for legitimate business purposes to enhance Company value and shall not pursue private interests.
article4.content2: Company funds and assets shall be used transparently and reasonably for approved purposes only, in accordance with prescribed uses.

article5.title: Article 5 (Protection and Security of Information)
article5.content1: Employees shall not provide Company information or undisclosed information to external parties through unlawful means and shall take responsibility for preventing leaks to unauthorized third parties.
article5.content2: When providing information to media organizations such as newspapers or broadcasters, employees must follow lawful procedures through properly authorized personnel.

article6.title: Article 6 (Prohibition of Workplace Harassment and Sexual Harassment)
article6.content1: Employees shall not engage in unwanted sexual contact, jokes, or actions that cause sexual humiliation.
article6.content2: Employees shall treat one another with respect and consideration, refraining from verbal, physical, or psychological abuse that causes humiliation, insult, or intimidation.

article7.title: Article 7 (Compliance with Ethical Standards)
article7.content: Employees shall faithfully comply with all ethical standards and bear responsibility for any violations.

article8.title: Article 8 (Standards for External Activities)
article8.content1: When engaging in external activities such as public speaking, writing, media interaction, or use of electronic communication such as Social Network Services (SNS), employees shall comply with the following:
article8.subcontent1: Clearly state that the opinion expressed is personal and not the official opinion of the Company.
article8.subcontent2: Ensure that external activities do not interfere with the Company's primary business operations.
article8.subcontent3: Strive to maintain fair market order and foster a sound investment culture.
article8.subcontent4: Avoid making definitive statements on uncertain matters or disparaging other virtual asset service providers.

article9.title: Article 9 (Obligations After Termination of Employment)
article9.content: When resigning, employees shall return all work-related materials and take appropriate follow-up measures, and shall not engage in acts that harm the interests of the Company or its clients even after leaving the Company.

chapter8.title: Chapter 8. Ethics as a Virtual Asset Custodian

article1.title: Article 1 (Secure Custody of Client Assets)
article1.content1: The Company shall comply with the following provisions for risk management and accident prevention:
article1.subcontent1: Client virtual assets shall be securely stored 100% in wallets completely separated from the Internet and maintained offline (hereinafter "cold wallets").
article1.subcontent2: Cold wallets shall be securely stored in physically isolated locations, and all procedures related to cold wallet operation shall comply with internal regulations.
article1.subcontent3: Cold wallets shall be managed securely against natural or environmental threats such as fire, as well as unauthorized access or theft, in accordance with internal regulations.

article2.title: Article 2 (Prevention of Conflicts of Interest)
article2.content1: The Company shall comply with the following provisions to minimize potential conflicts of interest in fulfilling its responsibilities as a custodian:
article2.subcontent1: If there is a possibility of conflict of interest, the Company shall consult in advance with the Compliance Officer to ensure that no issues arise in client protection.
article2.subcontent2: The Compliance Officer shall confirm and review whether business procedures and applicable standards may potentially violate laws or internal regulations in the course of duty.

article3.title: Article 3 (Prohibition of Re-delegation of Custodied Assets)
article3.content: The Company shall hold in substance the same type and quantity of virtual assets entrusted by clients and shall not re-delegate such assets to other institutions.

riskManagement.title: 1. Risk Management and Accident Prevention Guidelines (Internal Control and Audit Guidelines)

committee.title: (Risk Management Committee)
items: The Company may establish a Risk Management Committee.
If the Company establishes a Risk Management Committee pursuant to the preceding paragraph, the Committee shall deliberate and resolve on the following matters:
subItems: Establishment of basic policies and strategies for risk management
Deliberation and approval of newly entrusted virtual assets
Formulation and revision of risk management standards
Other matters necessary for risk management

standards.title: (Risk Management Standards)
items: The Company may establish standards and procedures (hereinafter "Risk Management Standards") for timely identification, evaluation, monitoring, and control of risks arising from the operation of virtual assets or proprietary assets, the performance of business, and other transactions.
Details to be specified in the Risk Management Standards and other necessary matters may include the following:
subItems: Structure and division of responsibilities of the organization dedicated to risk management
Procedures for risk management to be observed by employees in the performance of their duties
Procedures and methods for verifying employees' compliance with the Risk Management Standards
Formulation or amendment of the Risk Management Standards
Appointment and dismissal of the Risk Management Officer
Emergency risk management plan for incidents related to virtual assets and other contingencies

composition.title: (Composition of the Risk Management Committee, etc.)
items: The Company may appoint one or more Risk Management Officers to inspect and manage risks arising from asset operations, business performance, and other transactions.

Separate regulations shall be established regarding the appointment, dismissal, and tenure of the Risk Management Officer. In this case, the "Compliance Officer" shall be deemed the "Risk Management Officer."
Members of the Risk Management Committee shall be directors of the Board.

The Company shall organize and maintain an organization dedicated to risk management, staffed with an appropriate number of personnel with sufficient experience and competence, to support the following duties of the Risk Management Officer:
subItems: Inspection and analysis of risk limit operations
Timely provision of risk management information to the Risk Management Committee and executives
Other matters necessary for risk management

accidentPrevention.title: (Accident Prevention – Purpose of Business Inspection)
accidentPrevention.description: By self-assessing and monitoring compliance with internal control procedures, the purpose is to identify and rectify deficiencies immediately during the course of business execution, thereby contributing to rational business operations, prevention of accidents, and early detection of any incidents.

definitions.title: Definitions of Terms
items: Business Inspection: Internal self-inspection conducted under the supervision of the internal controller on whether all company business complies with external laws, regulations, guidelines, manuals, and directives. It is divided into daily and monthly inspections.
Issues: Matters identified during business inspections where external laws, regulations, guidelines, or manuals were not complied with, and which require corrective measures.

Advisory Matters: Cases identified during business inspections where external laws, regulations, guidelines, or manuals were not complied with, but the non-compliance was minor and did not require corrective measures, or corrective measures were completed within 5 business days from the date of identification.

principles.title: Principles of Business Inspection
items: Independence of Business Inspectors: Inspectors shall faithfully verify, from an independent standpoint, whether business was conducted properly in accordance with internal standards and procedures.
Right to Request Document Submission: Inspectors may request submission of documents necessary for performing inspection duties.

Obligation of Document Submission by Responsible Staff: Business staff must comply with requests for submission of materials by inspectors and faithfully provide materials related to inspections if their business is subject to inspection.

activities.title: Accident Prevention Activities
activities.description: - Internal Control Checklists (daily, monthly, quarterly): The internal controller carries out accident prevention activities based on checklists, subject to approval by the Compliance Officer and CEO.

conflictOfInterest.title: 2. Conflict of Interest Prevention Guidelines (Internal Control Regulations)

customerPriority.title: (Priority of Customer Interests)
items: Clients' interests shall take precedence over those of the Company, its shareholders, and its employees.
The Company's interests shall take precedence over those of its employees.
All clients' interests shall be treated equally.

blocking.title: (Blocking Conflict of Interest Issues)
items: Employees must not pursue their own interests or rewards through unlawful or improper means in the course of performing their duties.

Where an employee engages in external activities outside company duties with prior Company approval, they shall not use the Company's or clients' assets, personnel, or information acquired through their work for personal benefit.

management.title: (Identification, Assessment, and Management of Conflicts of Interest)
items: If employees are in or are likely to be in a conflict of interest between the Company and clients, or between clients, they shall consult with the Compliance Officer in advance and take measures to ensure that no client protection issues arise.

If a transaction has potential for conflict of interest, employees shall take measures to minimize such risk to ensure clients' interests are not harmed. Where minimizing such risks is deemed difficult, the fact shall be disclosed to the client, and such transaction shall be discontinued.

concurrentBusiness.title: (Prevention of Conflicts of Interest Arising from Concurrent Business Operations)
concurrentBusiness.description: If the Company engages in business activities other than virtual asset services, it shall comply with the following:
items: Where concurrent business may give rise to conflicts of interest, office spaces shall be separated.
Confirm and manage the exchange of information between concurrent business divisions and divisions that produce or acquire undisclosed internal information related to virtual assets.
Ensure that undisclosed internal information related to virtual assets is not used in concurrent business operations.

reEntrustmentProhibition.title: 3. Guidelines on Prohibition of Re-Entrustment of Virtual Assets (Internal Control Regulations)

custody.title: (Custody and Management of Client-Deposited Assets)
items: The Company shall safely keep the same type and quantity of virtual assets entrusted by clients and shall not re-entrust them to another institution.
The Company shall establish and operate a separate policy to ensure that client-deposited virtual assets are stored in cold wallets.

The Company shall conduct regular reconciliations between the Company's total holdings and the client's virtual asset records to verify consistency in type and quantity, and shall perform due diligence on the status of virtual asset holdings.

secureStorage.title: 4. Guidelines for Secure Custody of Virtual Assets (Wallet Guidelines)

coldWalletSecurity.title: (Cold Wallet Operation Security)
items: Cold wallets shall be stored securely in physically isolated locations.
Access and usage history of cold wallets shall be logged and securely managed, with regular inspections.
Cold wallets shall be controlled so that withdrawals can only occur through predefined procedures and methods.
coldWalletSecurity.note: - Internal controls and approval procedures, multi-signature, MPC, etc.

coldWalletManagement.title: (Cold Wallet Management Security)
items: Establish and implement safe backup and recovery measures for cold wallets.
Establish measures to minimize damage in case of theft or loss of cold wallets.
Establish security measures to prevent leakage, theft, or loss of cold wallet private keys.

assetSecurity.title: (Virtual Asset Security)
items: For newly entrusted virtual assets, verify safety and reliability through separate procedures.
When purchasing cold wallet hardware, ensure products are purchased with established reputation and stability in the market.
Disable unnecessary peripherals and interfaces of cold wallet hardware such as USB, speakers, microphones, networks, and CD drives.

operationProcedures.title: (Cold Wallet Operation Procedures)
operationProcedures.description: Cold wallets shall be kept in a secure state as follows to ensure safe management from natural and environmental threats such as fire and unauthorized access or theft:
items: Cold wallets shall be kept completely disconnected from all forms of networks.
Cold wallets shall be safeguarded against natural and environmental threats such as fire, and managed to prevent theft or unauthorized access.
Cold wallet access shall always be performed by at least two personnel together.
Locations storing cold wallets shall be designated as critical control zones, with enhanced access control and 24-hour video surveillance with no blind spots.

cryptoWarning.title: Precautions Regarding Virtual Asset Transactions
cryptoWarning.introduction: Recently, interest in virtual assets has been increasing, along with concerns about excessive investment and related crimes. This notice is intended to inform clients of the representative risks that may arise when trading or holding virtual assets.
risks: Virtual assets are not legal tender, and no specific entity guarantees their value.

Virtual assets are traded 24 hours a day, 365 days a year, worldwide. Their prices may fluctuate sharply due to various factors such as market supply and demand, policies of each virtual asset, national laws and regulations, and network conditions.
Virtual assets are not subject to price fluctuation limits, and customers should be especially aware of the possibility of principal loss.
Virtual assets are not protected under the Depositor Protection Act.

fraud.warning: Be cautious of 'telecommunications financial fraud, illegal fundraising, pyramid schemes, and phishing scams.'
details: Be cautious of acts that impersonate financial institutions or investigative agencies to request remittances, demand account lending, or induce investment under the pretext of airdrops, as these may constitute telecommunications financial fraud, illegal fundraising, or pyramid schemes.
KODA will never request clients' passwords, OTPs, SMS/ARS authentication, nor will it log in on behalf of customers.
Please exercise particular caution to prevent damage from telecommunications financial fraud, illegal fundraising and pyramid schemes, and phishing scams.

cryptoWarning.disclaimer: The above items briefly describe certain risks accompanying virtual asset transactions but do not cover all risks related to virtual asset trading. Please also note that this notice does not take precedence over relevant domestic or international laws and regulations.
